prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would.
gpt_response:
To find the difference between the total number of green tiles and blue tiles in the new figure, we first need to determine the number of green and blue tiles in the original figure. 

In the original figure, there are thirteen blue hexagonal tiles and six green hexagonal tiles. 

To create the border of green tiles in the new figure, we will add green tiles around the original figure. Each of the six green tiles in the original figure will have a corresponding green tile in the border, so an additional six green tiles will be added. 

Therefore, the total number of green tiles in the new figure will be 6 (from the original figure) + 6 (from the border) = 12 green tiles. 

Since the blue tiles in the original figure will not be affected by the addition of the border, the total number of blue tiles in the new figure will remain 13. 

Thus, the difference between the total number of green tiles and blue tiles in the new figure will be 12 (green tiles) - 13 (blue tiles) = -1. 

Therefore, the difference between the total number of green tiles and blue tiles in the new figure will be -1.
